delivery channels whether that satellite or cable TV or even over-the-air in your
neighborhood but now we can also deliver video directly using internet connection
so that became known as over-the-top delivery and oftentimes called OTT for

obvious benefits of using the media services inside of AWS as opposed to you
know trying to tackle these problems with the purchase of dedicated hardware
so with media services you basically pay for what you use and you pay as you go
so you're not making capital expenses you're making a sort of time variable expense which is very efficient you you
adapt your media storage and compute needs so what this really means is you're taking advantage of our very high
economies of scale so because AWS has you know very very large data centers
we're able to deliver the computation at a very low cost the unpredictability and
the burstiness is handled natively by media services this weekend you may need
to do one event next weekend you may need to do three in the old world you would have to buy three sets of encoding
equipment in order to do them all at the same time in the new world you just create three channels and when you're
done you you spin them down you can shorten the time to market and test out
new approaches so you know you can have launched a service in January and that can be running and in March you can say
you know I wonder if we did it completely differently let's set up a parallel channel with different

approaches we have global availability and I think a key premise here is that
it all works the same this is really such a great benefit of the media services which is that once you get a

transferred to you know an asia-pacific region and it it really does just work the same the the code versions are the

build an entire workflow that's not ad supported in any way so you control the total experience we allow customers to
scale with their success so these these non M&E customers that are kind of getting a toe in the water with video
you know they can do one classroom one session one one series of lectures they
can deliver that and then as that's successful they can scale that up and most importantly you know when the
semester is over or what-have-you everything can be shut off and no no cost has accrued either in the form of

additionally there's a very low barrier to entry so there's no special contracts

then lastly the AWS media services make the same video technology available to all customers so although I'm focusing
on the non and mini customer segments here it's not that we have a media service for you know the the premium
video operator and then we have a different media service for someone
who's doing simple streaming in the same way that there's not one s3 for people who use a lot in one s3 for people who
use a little it's the same technology made available to everybody which we think is a great thing so I've talked
about how easy and accessible this is and I want to just sort of give a very basic example here for for what would be
involved in in setting this up and it's
really very simple there's just three services that you connect together and you have a sort of worldwide streaming
distribution setup so the first service that's worth talking about and this will
sort of lay this out from the middle going out so we have this service AWS
elemental media store and what that is is an Origin server so an Origin server
is basically where your CDN and your encoder meet your encoder creates
segmented content periodically every few seconds across multiple bit rates and puts it in the origin store and then the
CDN when the players request content CDN comes to that store and asks for it now
it's very important that this be extremely low latency that it be high availability and that it be very durable
and the latency really matter because if the origin is you know sometimes stuttering and not able to
give that content then you need to increase the overall and end latency to deal with that so when we build media
store we really focused on that low latency piece and it has really good not only low jitter numbers but also very
low sorry not only does they have low latency numbers but it also has a very
low latency jitter so it's both low and predictable configuring media store is very easy you
go this is just a screenshot from the AWS console here is that big create container button on the right for every
container you've created you are given a URL it lives in whatever region you want
it to live in and then you basically can just take that URL and put it in both
the encoder and the CDN and and the two have met them the next step in the
workflow again starting from the middle and going out towards the players is CloudFront so media store works with all
CD ends we happily originate content to be delivered not only to our own CDN but
those CDMS from other providers in industry but it's very easy to configure
and set up with cloud front cloud front is really extremely straightforward you
don't have to talk to anybody to set it up it's all API and console driven this
is an example of what the cloud front user interface looks like this is a
cloud front distribution that I made and a distribution is basically just a way of saying I want to serve the content
that's currently in this media store container to the world at this endpoint address and it really is a worldwide
thing it takes care of you know finding the optimal path from the edge locations
back to that to that origin so you can
see here the player that was pointed at that domain name would serve content out
of that origin and so again that blue create distribution button is all that you need your aunt
few questions and then your your CloudFront distribution is being created and then of course the last thing that
you need is the transcoder so media live is an adaptive bitrate transcoder so I
think there's general familiarity of about this concept but of course when we do OTT video we don't just run one
transcode we run a large number at the same time typically five or maybe even
seven sometimes more transcodes and that's you know the largest screen size
your 1080p 30 you might do a 720 you might do a 540 360 where that's the
number of lines in each picture so it's progressively smaller and smaller pictures at lower and lower bit rates and we do that so that when the customer
who's receiving this video over the Internet gets into a bandwidth challenged state
they always have a piece of content they can go to as as their bandwidth this
constraint more and more they always have something they can reach for and still get over that pipe even if it's
impaired and so media live is the encoder that does exactly that it's basically a 1 in 2 n out transcoder
where and is typically five or seven or something like that and so those are the three services that
go together in the same way media live is very easy to configure this is the
create channel page so you give your channel a name you tell it where the
input comes from you can see on output groups over there I've got my my
individual outputs here you can see three of them and the screen shot you
tell media live that you want an input type it'll give you the input IP address
and you tell media live where to send the content in this case your media store bucket then of course the three
services together don't complete the whole picture you get some playback
devices whether it's just a browser on a desktop or you know an iOS device or something like that
you point them at the CloudFront distribution URLs and then of course you're gonna need a source and so that
source can come from a single camera it can be as simple as an app running on a
phone that's streaming like over rtmp can be delivered to media live many of
our customers do just that so you know the thing on the left end and the right end of this could be as

range anything from a small video production set up like what we have going here all the way down to like I

solution that's ready to be used for any type of event workload and that's really
sort of paipai by the hour and pay for each delivered byte so and then the last

to get started with media services but it's also easy to grow in sophistication over time so what I showed here is is

this is actually instead of using media store you can bring media package into the equation so media package is another

lie assets and turning them into VOD assets that can be watched later so this is
very popular for event based workflows basketball game can end and then you can
turn that segment of time into a URL that you could hand out to anybody later anybody and then later they can watch
that game from the beginning and then you can also bring in our product media
tailor which is a product that does server-side ad insertion so I think
we've all experienced when what's called player side ad insertion and we've all
experienced it when it's not very good you're watching video you come to the commercial break the players sort of
like freezes for a minute and then like some clearly new content shows up
different audio levels all kinds of problems it's not a great experience media tailor does all of that on the
server side so you get a really smooth broadcast like experience and like I
said it's more sophisticated but it shows a way in which people that have
kind of gotten into the streaming business can grow in sophistication over time and then of course we can't forget
